solution_line_template: Annie has three times more toys than Mike, which means she has {annie_multiplier} * {mike_toys} = <<{annie_multiplier}*{mike_toys}={annie_more_than_mike}>>{annie_more_than_mike} more toys than Mike.
Annie has a total of {annie_more_than_mike}+{mike_toys}= <<{annie_more_than_mike}+{mike_toys}={annie_total_toys}>>{annie_total_toys} toys.
Tom has two toys more than Annie, so he has {annie_total_toys} + {tom_more_than_annie} = <<{annie_total_toys}+{tom_more_than_annie}={tom_total_toys}>>{tom_total_toys} toys.
In total Annie, Mike, and Tom have {mike_toys} + {annie_total_toys} + {tom_total_toys} = <<{mike_toys}+{annie_total_toys}+{tom_total_toys}={total_toys}>>{total_toys} toys.
